primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God sustains and empowers His people and their leaders in the wilderness despite their sin and inadequacy.

tekstueel_bewijs: God supplied them with food and water
The Lord descended in the cloud and spoke
He took back part of that same spirit... and conferred it on the seventy

object.identificatie: Spiritual empowerment and preservation of the community
tekstueel_bewijs: life and health and safety to his people
carrying out of his divine purpose
The Lord of the church arranges things in wonderful ways

ontvanger.identificatie: The People of Israel / The Congregation
tekstueel_bewijs: what the Word of God might be for all of you

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Seventy Elders
tekstueel_bewijs: commissioning of persons by the Holy Spirit
they will share with you the burden

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is presented as an inescapable feature of human life that only divine intervention can mitigate.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The congregation responds to God's grace by pledging service and worship.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Congregation
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The response of the people (Ethics) is explicitly grounded in God's prior act of empowerment (Soteriology).

voorbeelden_god_subject: the one who alone can give life

voorbeelden: Choose here and now whom you will worship
they always want more and better
Moses knew what his limitations and failings were
I am not able to carry all this people alone
without God’s continual aid and empowerment
the divine gift that makes it possible

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses heavily on the lack of human power (incapacity) and the necessity of divine endowment (Pouvoir-faire).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Burden' (S2) to the realization that 'Human Effort' (~S1) is insufficient, leading to 'Divine Empowerment' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God resolves the tension by 'descending in the cloud' and conferring the Spirit.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Yes, the 'ugliness' of the church is described as inescapable without God.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently identifies God as the source of power and humans as the needy recipients. Even the call to action is framed as a response to God's prior work.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Moses was such a great and godly leader

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I am not able to carry all this people alone
It is up to him, not us.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Moses is used as a model, but specifically a model of *humility* and *dependence* rather than self-generated virtue.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Moses as a type of Christ who bears the burden, or Moses as the 'Receiver' of God's Spirit.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the pressure of performance; dependence on God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the biblical narrative to the parish's current situation is seamless and theologically consistent.
spanning_punten: The tension between the joy of the 'Red Sea' and the reality of the 'Wilderness' complaints.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: sharing in the leadership, by submitting to God’s guidance

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is seen as a constant threat to the community's life.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a strong example of grace-oriented preaching where God remains the Subject of the primary narrative.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The emphasis on 'cannot' (lack of power) is theologically appropriate for this text.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already takes the 'ugliness' of the church seriously.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in maintaining God's agency while addressing practical parish life.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'humanity' of Moses' speech, Greimas shows that the 'engine' of the story is actually God's transfer of power.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical role of the 70 elders; semiotics shows they function as 'Helpers' to the Subject (God) in the preservation of the 'Object' (Israel).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Burden' is the Opponent that necessitates a Subject-switch from Moses to God.

appendices.notities: Sermon preached by Fleming Rutledge; her 'Grammar of Grace' is evident throughout.
